result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by 9/21/2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: all court costs, fees and surcharge including DNA.  Cash bail to aply, if applicable.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  To commence on 10/3/2016 by 5:00 p.m.
   Day Reporting Center and huber privileges.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order For Cancellation of Huber/ Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Witkowiak Br 22 for review. os

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court vacates stayed bench warrant.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 1 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence, Day Reporting Center and Huber privileges; sentence to commence on 10--03-2016 by 5pm. 

Court orders defendant provided DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by 9-21-2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Sentencing Referral Form
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court.  Katherine Seelow for Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 9-21-2016 8:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

At the request of the defense, and without objection from the court or the state, sentencing hearing is moved from 09/15/2016 to 09/16/2016 at 8:30am in Branch 22.  Defendant to check in on 09/15/2016 to receive the new date.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Danielle Chojnacki for Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 08/15/2016 is vacated.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Defense attorney is in jury trial in another courtroom, case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, defense requests more time.  Court schedules final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed office visit, but made it up.  Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Katherine Seelow for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for contested doctors report hearing.  Sworn for the state: Dr. John Pankiewicz.  Exhibit 1 received and withdrawn.  Arguments heard.  Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Defense requests scheduling date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on doctors report.  State does not dispute the findings, however the defense contests the report.   Case adjourned for contested doctors report hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Forensic Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.
Recalled.
Jury trial date of 02/10/2016 is vacated.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Forensic evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Pankiewcz on 02/02/16  at 10:30am. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 1:30pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants Defense motion for adjourned final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants joint motion for adjourned final pre-trial and jury trial.  Jury trial date of 01/06/2015 is vacated.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Randy Sitzberger for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for motion hearing, however for reasons stated on the record, the defense withdraws their motion.  For reasons stated on the record, the court vacates the Jury Trial date of 11/30/2015 and final pre-trial date of 11/23/2015.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
State's Response to Defense Motion to Suppress received and filed.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Nick Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests motion hearing date.  State's reply due 9/29/2015. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 9/18/2015.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  Katherine Seelow for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to obtain discovery.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Cord Williams Klein.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Motion hearing scheduled for 09/10/2015 at 8:30 is converted to status of counsel in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Klein requests motion to withdraw hearing date.  Case scheduled for motion hearing 09/03/2015 at 8:30am.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.
for extension of time within which to file supression motion and brief received and filed.
of law supporting notice of motion and motion to suppress evidence obtained pursuant to illegal search of vehicle received and filed.
to suppress evidence obtained pursuant to illegal search of vehicle from the defense received and filed.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Cord Williams Klein.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 9/10/2015 at 8:30 am. Any motions are to be filed by 7/22/2015 and any response from the State is to be filed by 8/24/2015.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Cord Williams Klein.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defense requests a Status Conference. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Cord Williams Klein.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense received a DVD from the State on yesterdays date. Case calendared for STATUS on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Cord Williams Klein.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The defense cannot open the disc from the State. Case calendared for STATUS on 5/28/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Cord Williams Klein.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Counsel was just appointed on this case and needs a little time to review the discovery. Case calendared for STATUS on 5/14/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant believes there is a conflict with his counsel. Court grants Atty. Opland-Dobbs motion to withdraw. Case calendared for STATUS of COUNSEL on 5/7/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Randy Sitzberger for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Markel McKinley-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/14/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michael Thomas in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Michael Thomas in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
